sentences.en: Abstinence frees you from being valued on a performance basis.
sentences.cn: 节制使你不必因着行为而被人评价.

sentences.en: Abstinence frees you from the dangers of various birth control methods.
sentences.cn: 节制使你免于面对采用各种避孕手段的危险之中.

sentences.en: Abstinence frees you from the fear and consequences of pregnancy.
sentences.cn: 节制使你免于经受怀孕的恐慌和后果.

sentences.en: Abstinence from alcoholic drinks is advisable.
Abstinence provides freedom to enjoy being a young person.
sentences.cn: 节制提供了享受作年轻人的自由.

sentences.en: Both abstinence and sterilization can be enforced or voluntary.
sentences.cn: 节欲和绝育即可能是强制的也可能是自愿的.

sentences.en: Despite alcohol's popularity today, however, many still consider abstinence a virtue.
sentences.cn: 酒精现在虽然颇受欢迎, 但是许多人还是认为滴酒不沾是个美德.

sentences.en: In the temperance question, Mr White takes his stand on total abstinence.
sentences.cn: 在戒酒难题上, 怀特先生是主张完全戒掉.

sentences.en: Smoking can stain your teeth. You should have abstinence from smoking.
sentences.cn: 吸烟会让你的牙齿产生黄色或黑色的绣渍, 你应该彻底的戒烟!

sentences.en: The abstinence commitment can improve communication between couples, she suggests.
sentences.cn: 她建议贞洁的承诺能改善配偶之间的沟通.

sentences.en: The engagement lasted four years, an ordeal of abstinence.
sentences.cn: 这段婚姻维持了四年 —— 一段痛苦的节欲的考验.

sentences.en: The meaning of life was freedom and the abstinence from evil.
sentences.cn: 生命的真谛是自由和避免作恶.

sentences.en: Two day's abstinence had set it burning in fury.
sentences.cn: 两天的克制使它变成了熊熊烈火.

words.tran_cn: 禁欲的；有节制的；饮食有度的

trans.tran_en: the practice of not having something you enjoy, especially alcohol or sex, usually for reasons of religion or health
